page.title: 03Churches.
page.content: {Religion.}Belchamp Otten church is St Ethelbert and all saints St Ethelbert was saxon saint (the village of Belchamp St Ethelbert disappeared in the middle ages). The church dates to 1170, during restoration a stone coffin 800 yrs old, was found under the floor. The coffin made of Barnack Stone from Stamford Lincs. The church has 3 bells pre 1500 and a{very fine {small organ. Belchamp Walter church is St Mary the Virgin and contains some very fine wall paintings, including one of the Martyrdom of St Edmunds (Bury St Edmunds is 14 miles away) and the pelican pecking her breast to feed her young. The church has eight bells hence the name of the pub in the village. Belchamp Walter also contains a Mission Hall now used as a library.
